airtrafficcontrol.app.menuoptions

Class ExitOption

  • java.lang.Object
    • airtrafficcontrol.app.menuoptions.Option
      • airtrafficcontrol.app.menuoptions.ExitOption

  • public class ExitOption
extends Option
    This class represents the option with the title Exit app. of an Air Traffic Control app.

    Description

    The purpose of this class is to perform the action of exiting the app whose OptionsMenu contains this option; as so it must be the last of instance of type Option to be inserted in the parameters of the constructor of the instance of OptionsMenu that the app uses. For more information, read the documentation of method execute.

    Implementation notes

    • Instances of this class are immutable.
    • All instances of this class share the same title and description.
    • This subclass of Option was strictly created for the EHL's AIR TRAFFIC CONTROL app for console.
    Author:
    Eva Gomes, Hugo Leal, Lucas Andrade

    • Method Detail

      • getInstance

        public static ExitOption getInstance()
        Returns an instance of type ExitOption, without creating a new one.

        Note that the instances of this type have no differentiating properties: the only instance fields are title and description and their values are the same for all instances. This method lets you reuse an already created instance instead of always creating new ones with the constructor.

        Returns:
        A instance of type ExitOption.

      • executeToConsole

        public void executeToConsole(AirTrafficControlAppForConsole app)
                      throws InvalidArgumentException
        Prints a goodbye message to console.

        This implementation of the method executeToConsole() does not use the argument app because this subclass of Option was strictly created for the EHL's AIR TRAFFIC CONTROL app for console.

        Specified by:
        executeToConsole in class Option
        Parameters:
        app - An instance of AirTrafficControlAppForConsole.
        Throws:
        InvalidArgumentException - If app is null.

      • execute

        public java.lang.String execute()
                         throws InvalidArgumentException
        Produces a goodbye message.
        Specified by:
        execute in class Option
        Returns:
        The goodbye message.
        Throws:
        InvalidArgumentException - If the appTitle or appDeveloper are null.
